title: spack <command> ... : some no longer accept multiple specs
body:
It seems that commands that were accepting multiple spec constraints now discard everything but the first one. I suspect this may have something to do with changes in the way spec are parsed.

Reproducible by : 

```
$ spack install szip
==> Installing szip
==> Trying to fetch from file:///home/mculpo/production/spack-mirror/szip/szip-2.1.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100,0%
==> Staging archive: /home/mculpo/PycharmProjects/spack/var/spack/stage/szip-2.1-esfmhl54wbdb7nnnip6y6jbxlbmxs2jq/szip-2.1.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /home/mculpo/PycharmProjects/spack/var/spack/stage/szip-2.1-esfmhl54wbdb7nnnip6y6jbxlbmxs2jq
==> No patches needed for szip
==> Building szip
==> Successfully installed szip
  Fetch: 0.01s.  Build: 7.92s.  Total: 7.94s.
[+] /home/mculpo/PycharmProjects/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-4.8/szip-2.1-esfmhl54wbdb7nnnip6y6jbxlbmxs2jq

$ spack install zlib
==> Installing zlib
==> Trying to fetch from file:///home/mculpo/production/spack-mirror/zlib/zlib-1.2.8.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100,0%
==> Staging archive: /home/mculpo/PycharmProjects/spack/var/spack/stage/zlib-1.2.8-d6pdl6xvnvap6ihrqcqtgvweghbszmix/zlib-1.2.8.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /home/mculpo/PycharmProjects/spack/var/spack/stage/zlib-1.2.8-d6pdl6xvnvap6ihrqcqtgvweghbszmix
==> No patches needed for zlib
==> Building zlib
==> Successfully installed zlib
  Fetch: 0.01s.  Build: 3.23s.  Total: 3.24s.
[+] /home/mculpo/PycharmProjects/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-4.8/zlib-1.2.8-d6pdl6xvnvap6ihrqcqtgvweghbszmix

$ spack find szip zlib
==> 1 installed packages.
-- linux-x86_64 / gcc@4.8 ---------------------------------------
szip@2.1

$ spack find zlib szip
==> 1 installed packages.
-- linux-x86_64 / gcc@4.8 ---------------------------------------
zlib@1.2.8

$ spack uninstall szip zlib
==> The following packages will be uninstalled : 

-- linux-x86_64 / gcc@4.8 ---------------------------------------
esfmhl5 szip@2.1%gcc


==> Do you want to proceed ? [y/n]
...
```
